data.title: Top 100 Detective Films
data.meta_description:
Best Detective Films of All Time Movies with Crime Detection and Investigation plot in any form (drama, mystery, action and adventure, fantasy and science fiction, art-house, heist, gangster, comedies, noir, prison films, police procedural, courtroom drama, e.t.c.). I rank this list based on how well the movie represents the crime investigation genre over other genres.

Definition: The “Detective Film” is a subgenre of crime fiction and mystery fiction and can be defined as a film that focuses on a detective-hero’s investigation into the mystery surrounding a crime. For a film to belong to the detective genre, it requires two features: a narrative that follows an investigation, and a protagonist that functions as a detective-figure (police detective, private-eye, amateur, lawyer, journalist). The detective-figure studies the intriguing reasons and events leading to the crime, and eventually determines the identity of the villain (a murderer, a master spy, an arch fiend, an unseen evil, or a malignant psychological force). The central character usually explores the unsolved crime, unmasks the perpetrator, and puts an end to the effects of the villainy. 

Characteristics: crime mystery (murder, disappearance, kidnapping, fraud, scandal), investigation, law, justice, and punishment, the “whodunit” aspect, unraveled crimes in court, detective-story format to the spy plot, investigative journalism.

Essential / Must-see / Genre-defying: detective fiction movies: 
* The Maltese Falcon (1941)
* The Big Sleep (1946) 
* Vertigo (1958)
* Chinatown (1974)
* Murder On The Orient Express (1974)


Other Lists: Top 150 Crime Movies (All Time) (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls500076214/) Top 100 Murder Mystery Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls093994820) Top 50 Kidnapping Movies (https://www.imdb.com/list/ls025629524)

Movies with Crime Detection and Investigation plot in any form (drama, mystery, action and adventure, fantasy and science fiction, art-house, heist, gangster, comedies, noir, prison films, police procedural, courtroom drama, e.t.c.). I rank this list based on how well the movie represents the crime investigation genre over other genres.
